results.title: Teenagers create an animated film
results.creator_credit: Larry Eikleberry, Maurice Prather and Centron Educational Films
results.brief_description: Documents the efforts of junior high school students in producing an animated film, “Gone with the antennas”. Shows the step-by-step process of how an animated film can be produced with a minimum of expense by a youthful group.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Larry Eikleberry, Maurice Prather and Centron Educational Films

results.title: Teenage pregnancy
results.creator_credit: Hector Lemieux, Joe Hayward, Moreland-Latchford Productions and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: Shows the reaction of a family when one of the daughters reveals that she is pregnant. Presents the decisions to be made concerning both the mother-to-be and the coming child, ignoring the responsibility of the father and concentrating on the girl’s problem.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hector Lemieux, Joe Hayward, Moreland-Latchford Productions and Sterling Educational Films

results.title: Teenage movies in competition
results.brief_description: Contains excerpts from twelve award-winning films made by young filmmakers “out to communicate ideas…to make a personal statement… to examine a civic problem…to educate or just to have fun.” All films submitted for the “Teenage Movies Competition” run by Kodak.

results.title: Teenage girl
results.creator_credit: Sam Napier-Bell, Leon Clore, Basic Films and British Information Services
results.brief_description: A sixteen-year-old girl’s interests and successive choices of careers are shown humorously. Indicates the opportunities waiting for school-leavers of both sexes.

results.title: Teddy bears at play [1959]
results.creator_credit: Winifred Lade, Mel F. Nichols and Australian National Travel Association
results.brief_description: A re-issue of a 1939 film, famous for its intimate study of the koala. This quaint and friendly creature with its soft round furry body is the most popular of Austrlia’s unique animals. Photographed by Mel. F. Nichols, edited by Winifred Lade.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Winifred Lade, Mel F. Nichols and Australian National Travel Association

results.title: Teddy
results.brief_description: A youthful African American man and his fight for equality for himself and for others through education. He goes to community meetings at South Park and connects with the fringe of the Black Panthers.

results.title: Techniques of swimming
results.creator_credit: Ruth Irons, Paul Quinlan and Department of Education, Queensland
results.brief_description: Bill Sweetenham, head coach, and Joe King, assistant coach of the Australian team at the Moscow Olympics, lecture on long distance swimmming and discuss stroke techniques and advanced drills. BEST SUITED TO COACHES AND TEACHERS.

results.title: Techniques of paper sculpture
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the basic techniques of paper sculpture - the cut, bend, fold and score - and their application in making a mask and a party favour. Shows commercial applications in window sets, art posters, and stage sets.

results.title: Technical student
results.creator_credit: John Fletcher, Leon Clore and Basic Films
results.brief_description: Facilities for technological training in Britain today, particularly in relation to industry. The “sandwich” course typifying the cooperation being achieved between industry and education. Follows students through a four-year electronic engineering course alternating six months employment in the factory with six months study under a tutor at a technical college.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Fletcher, Leon Clore and Basic Films

results.title: Tech Talk. Episodes 15 & 16.
results.creator_credit: John Kyle, Allenog Pty Ltd and Channel 0\28
results.brief_description: A compilation tape containing eight programmes designed to help young people in their career choices. There is also a segment on survival skills. Presented by Michael Schilberger, the topics covered:- traffic officer, fashion modelling, baker, how to use the CES part 3, rigger, timber worker/ sawyer, turf mangement/green keeping and finding an apprenticeship.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Kyle, Allenog Pty Ltd and Channel 0\28
